meanings: reading (of a kanji, esp. kun reading)

idioms.word: 論語読みの論語知らず
idioms.reading: ろんごよみのろんごしらず
idioms.meaning: knowing a theory without being able to apply it

lessons.japanese: 本を取ってそれを読みなさい。
lessons.english: Take a book and read it.

lessons.japanese: 本を取ってそれを読みなさい。
lessons.english: Take a book and read it.

lessons.japanese: 君はもうその本を読み終えましたか。
lessons.english: Have you finished reading that book yet?

lessons.japanese: 君はその本をそんなに早く読み終わってしまうことはできない。
lessons.english: You will not be able to go through the book so quickly.

lessons.japanese: その小説は読み終えましたか。
lessons.english: Have you finished reading the novel?

lessons.japanese: その小説は読み終わったの？
lessons.english: Have you finished reading the novel?

lessons.japanese: この本はもう読みましたか。
lessons.english: Have you read this book already?

lessons.japanese: この本はもう読みましたか。
lessons.english: Have you read this book yet?

lessons.japanese: 君はこの本の数ページは読みさえすればよい。
lessons.english: You have only to read a few pages of this book.

lessons.japanese: 君の読みたいどんな本でも読んでよい。
lessons.english: You may read whichever book you like.

lessons.japanese: 教科書を正しく読みなさい。
lessons.english: You must read the textbook closely.
